page.title: 16MUSIC IN HORLEY
page.content: Most musical activities for young people are school based.Class lessons and music clubs provide opportunities for singing and instrumental work (recorder, guitar,flute,clarinet) Lessons are provided by visiting teachers, violins by a local education authority teacher, and for wind and brass instruments by a private teacher Some instruments may be hired from the education authorities.St Bartholomew's Church has a small children's orchestra which rehearses on Sundays and periodically plays at Sunday services. In March the Rotary Club of Horley organized a concert of young talent from the area,which they hope to repeat in other years.Horley Choral Society meets regulary at St.Wilfreds Church Hall, it was founded 20 years ago.
